alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 2:38PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL IRON AND SOUTHEASTERN ASHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM CDT... At 237 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Upson, or 13 miles north of Turtle Flambeau Flowage, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Iron and southeastern Ashland Counties, including the following locations... Island Lake Iron County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle.
